Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: check constraint value that is used to maintain therelationship between SUPPORT FACILITY and its various sub-types. In this table,may only be SF_BRIDGE.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are usedtomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BRIDGE CAPACITY: the carrying capacity of the bridge.
Column Comment.5: BRIDGE HEIGHT: the height of the bridge where the bridge is covered.
Column Comment.7: BRIDGE LENGTH: the total length of the bridge.
Column Comment.9: BRIDGE TYPE: A valid type of bride, such as permanent steel, wood, winter ice etc.
Column Comment.10: BRIDGE WIDTH: The width of the bridge
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: SURFACE TYPE: A valid list of surface types for various support facility. May includeconcrete, asphalt, dirt, gravel, sand etc.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
